title: mindsets
extract: A mindset is a series of self-perceptions or beliefs people hold about themselves. These determine behaviour, outlook and mental attitude. For example, believing you are either 'intelligent' or 'unintelligent'. Two mindsets have been identified by Carol Dweck, (Professor of Psychology at Stanford University).
extract_html: A mindset is a series of self-perceptions or beliefs people hold about themselves. These determine behaviour, outlook and mental attitude. For example, believing you are either 'intelligent' or 'unintelligent'. Two mindsets have been identified by Carol Dweck, (Professor of Psychology at Stanford University).
